meanings.definition: Make a series of quick, high-pitched sounds
meanings.sent1: The birds chittered happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: The squirrels chittered as they played in the park.
meanings.sent3: The forest was alive with the chittering of birds and squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The chittering of the birds filled the air like a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the chittering of the birds on that sunny day.

meanings.definition: To utter a series of quick, high-pitched sounds, as a bird
meanings.sent1: The robin chittered a cheerful tune from the branch.
meanings.sent2: The canary chittered happily in its cage.
meanings.sent3: The chittering of the bird made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chittered through the room like a song.
meanings.sent5: The bird's chittering was a sweet sound in the morning.

meanings.definition: To make a rapid series of short, high-pitched sounds, as a squirrel
meanings.sent1: The squirrel chittered excitedly as it found a nut.
meanings.sent2: The chittering squirrel darted across the yard.
meanings.sent3: The chittering squirrel seemed to be telling a story.
meanings.sent4: The chittering of the squirrel echoed through the quiet forest.
meanings.sent5: I could hear the squirrel chittering happily outside my window.
